1.question: Is the signed SWPPP available at the construction site?

standards.SPECs, 13-1.03A General: Retain a printed copy of the authorized WPCP or SWPPP at the job site.
standards.CGP, Order XIV.C SWPPP Requirements: Risk level 1, 2, and 3 dischargers shall make the SWPPP available at the construction site during working hours while construction is occurring and shall be made available upon request by a State or Municipal inspector.
standards.LTP, Order IX.D Availability and Public: LTP, Order IX.D Availability and Public Records Access The SWPPP and any amendments shall be kept on site during construction activity and made available upon request of a representative of the Regional Water Board or any local storm water management agency which receives the storm water discharge.

2.question: Is the SWPPP (and any amendments) prepared and signed by a certified QSD?

standards.SPECs, 13-3.01A Summary: You may assign a QSD other than the WPC manager to develop the SWPPP
standards.CGP, Order VII.B.1 SWPPP Certification R: Risk level 1, 2, and 3 dischargers shall ensure that SWPPPs are written, amended and certified by a Qualified SWPPP Developer (QSD).
standards.LTP, Order VII.B.1 SWPPP Certification R: The discharger shall ensure that SWPPPs are written, amended and certified by a Qualified SWPPP Developer (QSD).
